image.altText: A man with a microphone smiles

props.synopsis: There are fears an air strike that killed the deputy head of Hamas in Beirut could draw the Lebanese-based Hezbollah militant group into a more serious escalation of its conflict with Israel.

title.children: Deputy Hamas leader killed in alleged Israeli drone strike in Lebanon

image.altText: Plane engulfed in flames at nightfall

props.synopsis: Twelve Australians were among more than 370 people who escaped a burning airliner after a collision with a Coast Guard aircraft at Tokyo's Haneda airport.

title.children: 12 Australians among 379 safe in 'miracle' escape from burning aircraft at Tokyo airport, five die in small aircraft

image.altText: A middle-aged woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The husband of a palliative care nurse, who apparently died by suicide, is questioned during a coronial inquest into her death about whether or not he faked having post-traumatic stress disorder so he could claim compensation.

title.children: Man who is 'person of interest' in wife's death denies faking PTSD for money

image.altText: Two police officers talk to each other on the side of a road

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who died in a "tragic situation" after being struck by a car on the Tasman Highway near midnight was lying on the road, police believe.

title.children: Boy 'lying on the road' struck and killed in Tasmanian highway crash, police say

image.altText: Elaine sitting on the couch in her living room.

props.synopsis: Despite working since her 16th birthday, Elaine retired with just $45,000 in superannuation. Research shows superannuation is the biggest driver of wealth inequality in Australia – and women have much less of it than men.

title.children: 'I had so much promise in my life, and that's where I ended up': A lifetime of work leads to $45k in superannuation

image.altText: A Facebook photo of former professional cyclist Melissa Hoskins.

props.synopsis: The family of Melissa Hoskins say they are "utterly devastated" following the death of the Olympic cyclist over the weekend.

title.children: 'Her children have lost their mum': Family of Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins speaks out

image.altText: A woman wearing grey shirt applies a torniquet to the upper arm of a man in face mask

props.synopsis: From learning combat basics to debunking disinformation in civil defence courses bankrolled by a tech billionaire, these ordinary Taiwanese citizens are preparing for war with China.

title.children: Robert Tsao once renounced his own Taiwanese citizenship. Now he's funding a civilian force to fight China

image.altText: Rafael Nadal  holds up his tennis raquet and arms and smiles.

props.synopsis: Rafael Nadal is back. The Spanish great was emphatic in every part of his first round victory over Dominic Thiem at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Standing ovation as Rafael Nadal destroys fellow slam champion on return to tennis

image.altText: A newborn baby.

props.synopsis: The kids who were part of the ABC's Life At documentary series are now adults — and researchers say they've provided valuable insight into the challenges of growing up.

title.children: The ABC filmed Shine's birth for a documentary. Now she's all grown up

image.altText: A man and a woman stand against a moody background with a bridge

props.synopsis: It started in Denmark with The Killing and The Bridge, but Nordic noir has gone on to reshape the global television industry.

title.children: Nordic Noir TV has taken over the world. But how did it get so good?

image.altText: An ambulance on Park Beach driving along the sand

props.synopsis: A woman has died and a child has been rescued after both were caught in a rip at a Coffs Harbour beach on NSW's Mid North Coast.

title.children: Woman dies after getting caught in rip at Coffs Harbour beach

image.altText: A young woman holds up her student card.

props.synopsis: University student Rhianna Hilditch was recently shocked to discover she was not eligible for a student concession on Adelaide's public transport system because she takes courses online — but some are pushing for that rule to be changed.

title.children: Rhianna studies online and assumed she was eligible for concession travel. She was wrong

image.altText: An aerial shot of a new housing suburb

props.synopsis: In the face of continued interest rate hikes, persistent inflation, and a deeply negative consumer sentiment, property prices kept rising. So what's next?

title.children: The biggest surge in suburb property prices for 2023 was 32.8pc. Here's how suburbs across the country compare

image.altText: Insulin testing equipment with a needle to the right and a small electronic device for testing levels left

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute say they've discovered a way to make pancreatic cells produce insulin using existing cancer drugs.

title.children: Researchers say diabetes treatment breakthrough could lead to end of insulin injections

image.altText: A damaged helicopter on a sandbank.

props.synopsis: An ATSB interim report reveals traces of cocaine found in Sea World pilot's system after the crash, and that it has issued an industry-wide safety notice about seatbelts on passengers not being fitted correctly on a regular basis.

title.children: Tests find traces of cocaine in pilot killed in Sea World helicopter crash

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A view from above showing houses that have been damaged after an earthquake.

props.synopsis: A series of powerful earthquakes struck central Japan on Monday, killing at least 55 people, officials say, and destroying buildings, knocking out power to tens of thousands of homes, and prompting residents in some areas to flee.

title.children: Japan earthquake death toll rises to 55 with rescuers in 'battle against time' to find survivors

image.altText: Australia celebrates with the trophy after defeating India in it ODI matches.

props.synopsis: Phoebe Litchfield's century spurs Australia to a 190-run defeat of India in the third women's ODI in Mumbai, securing a 3-0 series sweep.

title.children: Record-breaking Aussies seal 3-0 ODI sweep of India

image.altText: A man works on the underbelly of an electric vehicle inside a mechanics' shop.

props.synopsis: The surge in EV sales in Australia has shaken up the automotive industry, which has raised questions about whether there will be enough mechanics who can work on these cars in the future.

title.children: More EVs are hitting Australian roads than ever. What does that mean for mechanics?

image.altText: Heavy rain and road blocked with a 'road flooded' sign.

props.synopsis: The wet weather is moving north to the Sunshine Coast, but the severe weather warning has been cancelled this afternoon.

title.children: ADF deployed to Queensland as threat of rainfall and flash flooding moves north

image.altText: A front-on close-up of a crocodile laying on a muddy river bank.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government is investigating after a Mackay fisher said a crocodile that had been "watching" him launched into his boat on Sunday night.

title.children: Man says 4-metre croc jumped into his tinnie 'jaws wide open' after watching him on New Year's Eve

image.altText: Man with army green jacket walks amid building smoke and debris

props.synopsis: Several Ukrainian cities have been pounded with shelling as Russian President Vladimir Putin promises to avenge a New Year's Eve attack which saw 24 Russian civilians killed.

title.children: Russia's fresh assault on Ukraine sees at least five civilians killed and dozens injured

image.altText: A man with shoulder-length blonde hair looking into the camera as he speaks

props.synopsis: Lachlan Galbraith posts a video apology after CCTV footage of him shoplifting was made public by a New Zealand store.

title.children: Ocean Alley band member makes public apology after being caught shoplifting on CCTV

image.altText: A cartoon mouse in shorts smiles while holding onto a steering wheel of a boat.

props.synopsis: The 1928 black and white animated version of Mickey Mouse is now free for people to use after 95 years.

title.children: First version of Disney's Mickey Mouse enters public domain, kind of

image.altText: A Facebook profile photo of a man in a singlet.

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old Queensland man charged over Sunday's outback rail crash at a crossing on the Barrier Highway that killed two freight train drivers is granted bail, on the condition that he report daily to police.

title.children: Truckie granted bail after horror crash that killed freight train drivers near SA-NSW border

image.altText: Smoke rising from a burning factory fire.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities have contained a factory fire on Plummer Road in Laverton North.

title.children: Factory fire sends smoke billowing over Melbourne's west

image.altText: Flowers up against a limestone wall.

props.synopsis: Authorities in charge of a popular riverside recreation spot say they will review safety measures at the site following the drowning of two children on New Year's Eve.

title.children: Burswood Park safety review announced as tributes are left for children who drowned on New Year's Eve

image.altText: A large blue fish

props.synopsis: Locals were upset after they spotted a man in a wetsuit and snorkel, carrying a speargun and hauling the endangered fish across the rock platform at  Cronulla.

title.children: Outrage over fine for spearing of blue groper at Sydney beach

image.altText: A Korean man in suitgrabs another man in the middle of a tightly packed crowd.

props.synopsis: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol says "violence must never be tolerated" after opposition leader undergoes surgery following knife attack.

title.children: South Korean opposition leader undergoes surgery after being stabbed in the neck

image.altText: Lots of people at the beach

props.synopsis: Police say two friends, who had been travelling across the state, were sleeping in a vehicle parked at Twilight Beach when another person opened their car door during the night.

title.children: Woman sleeping in car allegedly sexually assaulted at popular WA beach

image.altText: Composite image of two smiling young blonde boys, one holding a butterfly (left) and one headshot with head tilted up

props.synopsis: The families of two young boys who died when they were thrown from an off-road vehicle into a waterhole during a Christmas holiday in New Zealand say their hearts are "unmendable".

title.children: WA boy and cousin die after being thrown from vehicle into waterhole on New Zealand farm

image.altText: A composite image showing a woman walking, a firefighter, a female soccer player and King Charles.

props.synopsis: Editors have picked the most significant photos from across the world in 2023. Take a look back at the year in news.

title.children: The biggest headlines of 2023 captured by photographers across the world
